4785.verse: By the star when it descends,

4786.verse: Your companion [Muhammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,

4787.verse: Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.

4788.verse: It is not but a revelation revealed,

4789.verse: Taught to him by one intense in strength -

4790.verse: One of soundness. And he rose to [his] true form

4791.verse: While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.

4793.verse: And was at a distance of two bow lengths or nearer.

4794.verse: And he revealed to His Servant what he revealed.

4795.verse: The heart did not lie [about] what it saw.

4796.verse: So will you dispute with him over what he saw?

4797.verse: And he certainly saw him in another descent

4798.verse: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary -

4799.verse: Near it is the Garden of Refuge -

4800.verse: When there covered the Lote Tree that which covered [it].

4801.verse: The sight [of the Prophet] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit].

4802.verse: He certainly saw of the greatest signs of his Lord.

4803.verse: So have you considered al-Lat and al-'Uzza?

4804.verse: And Manat, the third - the other one?

4805.verse: Is the male for you and for Him the female?

4806.verse: That, then, is an unjust division.

4807.verse: They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allah has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance.

4808.verse: Or is there for man whatever he wishes?

4809.verse: Rather, to Allah belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].

4810.verse: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allah has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.
